greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Logarithmic derivative, wrt x, of triangle A227543, as read by terms k=0..n*(n-1)/2 in rows n>=1.
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1350 (rows n=1..20 of triangle, flattened).
formula: L.g.f.: Sum_{k=0..n*(n-1)/2, n>=1} T(n,k)*x^n*q^k/n = Log(G(x,q)) where G(x,q) = 1 + x*G(q*x,q)*G(x,q) is the g.f. of triangle A227543.
Row sums form A001700, the logarithmic derivative of the Catalan numbers.
Sum_{k=0..n*(n-1)/2} T(n,k) = binomial(2*n-1, n-1), for n>=1.
Sum_{k=0..n*(n-1)/2} T(n,k)*exp(2*Pi*I*k/n) = (-1)^(n-1) for n>=1; i.e., the n-th row sum at q = exp(2Pi*I/n), the n-th root of unity, equals -(-1)^n for n>=1.
Sum_{k=0..[n/2]} T(n, n*k) = A145855(n), the number of n-member subsets of 1..2n-1 whose elements sum to a multiple of n.
L.g.f. satisfies: L'(x,q) = P'(x,q)/P(x,q) - Q'(x,q)/Q(x,q), where
due to Ramanujan's continued fraction identity. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Dec 28 2016
example: where exponentiation yields the g.f. of triangle A227543:
program: (PARI) {T(n, k)=local(A=1); for(i=1, n, A=1+x*subst(A, x, q*x)*A +x*O(x^n)); n*polcoeff(polcoeff(log(A), n, x), k, q)}
polcoeff(polcoeff(P'/P - Q'/Q, n-1, x), k, q)}
for(n=1, 10, for(k=0, n*(n-1)/2, print1(T(n, k), ", ")); print("")) \\ _Paul D. Hanna_, Dec 28 2016
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jul 14 2013
